name: Desert Trails Bed and Breakfast

reviews.text: Stayed one night at Desert Trails and would have liked a little more time there - we arrived late and so didn't really have a chance to enjoy the place as much as we would have liked to.
reviews.title: Great Place for a Romantic Get-away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent quality rooms, friendly hosts, and a fabulous breakfast are what make this B&B a worth while stop while in Tucson. We chose the B&B based on it's proximity to Saquaro NP East and it's location on the edge of the city. Birders will like the natural habitat, nearby roads, and feeders.
reviews.title: Great place away from the crowds

reviews.text: We stayed in the Spud Room - very comfortable bed, large ensuite bathroom, high ceilings, tastefully decorated and clean. Fridge available for guest use. Evening access to kitchen and coffee/tea and snacks.
reviews.title: Nice quiet location and facility with nice innkeepers

description: Enjoy the beauty and tranquility of the Sonoran desert from the comfort of a unique, fired-adobe territorial situated on acreage bordering Saguaro National Park East. Different delicious full breakfast everyday and complimentary snacks, fruit, and beverages. Hiking, birding, wildlife viewing and horseback riding within walking distance; dining and shopping within 15-20 minutes.
